title: Google\Cloud\GkeBackup\V1\RestoreConfig
name: RestoreConfig
description:
Configuration of a restore.

Next id: 9

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.RestoreConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.volume_data_restore_policy
params.description: Specifies the mechanism to be used to restore volume data. Default: VOLUME_DATA_RESTORE_POLICY_UNSPECIFIED (will be treated as NO_VOLUME_DATA_RESTORATION).

params.name: data.cluster_resource_conflict_policy
params.description: Defines the behavior for handling the situation where cluster-scoped resources being restored already exist in the target cluster. This MUST be set to a value other than CLUSTER_RESOURCE_CONFLICT_POLICY_UNSPECIFIED if [cluster_resource_restore_scope][google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.RestoreConfig.cluster_resource_restore_scope] is not empty.

params.name: data.namespaced_resource_restore_mode
params.description: Defines the behavior for handling the situation where sets of namespaced resources being restored already exist in the target cluster. This MUST be set to a value other than NAMESPACED_RESOURCE_RESTORE_MODE_UNSPECIFIED.

params.name: data.cluster_resource_restore_scope
params.description: Identifies the cluster-scoped resources to restore from the Backup. Not specifying it means NO cluster resource will be restored.

params.name: data.all_namespaces
params.description: Restore all namespaced resources in the Backup if set to "True". Specifying this field to "False" is an error.

params.name: data.selected_namespaces
params.description: A list of selected Namespaces to restore from the Backup. The listed Namespaces and all resources contained in them will be restored.

params.name: data.selected_applications
params.description: A list of selected ProtectedApplications to restore. The listed ProtectedApplications and all the resources to which they refer will be restored.

params.name: data.substitution_rules
params.description: A list of transformation rules to be applied against Kubernetes resources as they are selected for restoration from a Backup. Rules are executed in order defined - this order matters, as changes made by a rule may impact the filtering logic of subsequent rules. An empty list means no substitution will occur.

methods.name: getVolumeDataRestorePolicy
methods.description:
Specifies the mechanism to be used to restore volume data.

Default: VOLUME_DATA_RESTORE_POLICY_UNSPECIFIED (will be treated as NO_VOLUME_DATA_RESTORATION).

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.RestoreConfig.VolumeDataRestorePolicy volume_data_restore_policy = 1;

methods.name: setVolumeDataRestorePolicy
methods.description:
Specifies the mechanism to be used to restore volume data.

Default: VOLUME_DATA_RESTORE_POLICY_UNSPECIFIED (will be treated as NO_VOLUME_DATA_RESTORATION).

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.RestoreConfig.VolumeDataRestorePolicy volume_data_restore_policy = 1;

params.name: var
params.description:
Specifies the mechanism to be used to restore volume data.

Default: VOLUME_DATA_RESTORE_POLICY_UNSPECIFIED (will be treated as NO_VOLUME_DATA_RESTORATION).

methods.name: getClusterResourceConflictPolicy

Defines the behavior for handling the situation where cluster-scoped resources being restored already exist in the target cluster. Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.RestoreConfig.ClusterResourceConflictPolicy cluster_resource_conflict_policy = 2;

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.gkebackup.v1.RestoreConfig.ClusterResourceConflictPolicy cluster_resource_conflict_policy = 2;
